benchmark_details.name: PrinciplismQA
benchmark_details.overview: PrinciplismQA is a comprehensive benchmark designed to systematically evaluate the ethical reasoning of Large Language Models in medicine, grounded in core principles of medical ethics and combining knowledge-based questions with practice-oriented case studies.
benchmark_details.data_type: multiple-choice questions and open-ended case studies

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the ethical reasoning capabilities of large language models in the medical domain, ensuring models align with established medical ethics principles.

data.source: Curated from 350 authoritative medical ethics textbooks and case analysis articles from the AMA Journal of Ethics.

methodology.calculation: Model performance is measured based on the proportion of correct responses to questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better ethical reasoning alignment with medical ethics.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through the LLM-as-a-Judge paradigm and human expert review.
